thread.title: Over 20 Hurt And 12 In Critical Condition After Truck Plows Into Crowd At Mardi Gras Parade In New Orleans
thread.title_full: Over 20 Hurt And 12 In Critical Condition After Truck Plows Into Crowd At Mardi Gras Parade In New Orleans

author: paulsacca
title: Over 20 Hurt And 12 In Critical Condition After Truck Plows Into Crowd At Mardi Gras Parade In New Orleans
text:
BREAKING: Dozen people critically injured after car ran into New Orleans parade crowd #Endymion #Krewe #NOLA #NOPD https://t.co/3MMoEnBzkd pic.twitter.com/diHr3WZbPd 
— Bill Benson (@LebanonLinkNews) February 26, 2017 

Over 20 people are injured, 12 of which are said to be in critical condition, after a truck plowed into the crowd at a Madi Gras parade in New Orleans, Louisiana. The crash happened on Saturday at about 6:45 p.m. at the Krewe of Endymion parade in the Mid-City section of New Orleans. The suspect is in custody, but their motive if any is unknown at this time. Terrorism is not suspected, but drunk driving could very well be. 
One officer struck, 21 people injured (several in critical condition) after car crashed into people during Endymion parade in Mid-City @wdsu pic.twitter.com/yTC9nP6l3i 
— Fletcher Mackel (@FletcherWDSU) February 26, 2017 
Witness: Truck plowed into crowd at Endymion parade. Multiple injuries https://t.co/oEtk5wyk4w pic.twitter.com/Z3j8T70zF7 
— Jennifer Crockett (@CrockettWDSU) February 26, 2017 
@Wdsu live on Facebook scene of truck crashing into crowd at Endymion Parade. Mayor & Police to speak on @wdsu TV pic.twitter.com/vsuhLkiMjC 
— Jennifer Crockett (@CrockettWDSU) February 26, 2017 
Raw video via WDSU photog of scene after truck crashes into crowd along parade route. https://t.co/Ick74qhh1T 
(Viewer discretion advised) pic.twitter.com/Qcb8SiTovh 
— wdsu (@wdsu) February 26, 2017
